page.title: 04HOTHAM AND CAVE CONFLICT
page.content: During the Civil War between Oliver Cromwell and King James 1, there was considerable disagreement between villagers in North Cave and Hotham. The people in Hotham supported Cromwell whereas North Cave residents favoured James l. At this time Cromwell's men visited North Cave Church vandalising two alabaster memorials by chopping off their hands and feet and damaging their faces. They remain near the altar steps. Cromwell's men were coming so the church silver was given to the shepherd at Manor Farm for safety. It is suspected to be hidden in a tunnel connecting the church to the vicarage but has never been found. There is evidence of a tunnel which runs deep under Church Street. What secret does it hold?
